finding: The study identified two non-structural proteins (NSP2 and NSP3) in the chikungunya virus that exhibit RNA interference (RNAi) suppressor activity.
The findings suggest that NSP2 and NSP3 have RNAi suppressor activity by binding to small RNA molecules and suppressing RNAi-mediated gene silencing.
The study revealed that the RNAi suppressor activity of NSP2 and NSP3 is conserved among alphaviruses, including chikungunya virus.
Electrophoretic mobility shift assay was used to evaluate the binding of small RNA molecules to the chikungunya virus NSP2 and NSP3 proteins.
The study showed that the RNAi suppressor activity of NSP2 and NSP3 is also conserved among small RNA molecules in other alphaviruses, as predicted using BINDn software.
